website_summaries.verdict: Excellent quality can-style headphones with great sound that is worth the extra cost.
pros: Closed-back headphones that include a 6-foot cable, a replacement set of ear pads, an additional cable and a storage case
Microfiber earphone covers are comfortable to wear over long periods of time
cons: Much more expensive than many other Shure models

website_summaries.verdict: The Shure SRH1540 is among the more accurate headphone pairs we've tested, delivering deep lows and crisp highs clearly with very little boosting.
pros: Ships with two detachable cables, a replacement pair of earcups, and the sturdiest hard-shell headphone case we've ever seen
cons: No inline remote control or mic on either cable

customer_reviews.title: If you can find the money don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.text: I'm delighted with the these headphones. It was a big decision for me spending £400 on such a private luxury but they are worth every penny. I'm no hi fi expert but have spent my life working with live music and sound balancing for performance. This is a satisfying, clean, clear and understated, balanced sound. I son't think you can ask for more. They're comfortable too with no perceptible sound leakage. Good sturdy lead which is a good length and looks sure to last. Oh and I love the hard, zipped storage case (I have a small dog!) And the spare (sturdy) lead and spare cushions show confidence from the maker in a long and happy future.
customer_reviews.author: Hyacynth

customer_reviews.title: They didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were highly recommended in reviews, so I took a chance in ordering without hearing them. I shouldn't have - 'try before you buy' applies here. Fed from my Samsung tablet they sounded as if the frequency balance was entirely wrong, being really bass heavy and vocals really recessed. Maybe my Samsung wasn't a good match, or maybe they didn't suit my hearing but within hours I decided that I couldn't live with them and sent them back for a refund. I've now got some Sennheiser Momentums, and for me they're much better.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: The best over ear cans I have ever used. Very highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: The best over ear cans I have ever used. Neutral sounding and very comfortable for extended wear. Includes case, spare covers and spare lead. The sound from these highly detailed cans is just fabulous. All music types benefit from the very clever sound engineering in these Shure headphones. I could not imagine anyone not liking the sound produced by these little marvels. Very highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: xrn

customer_reviews.title: Simply Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Simply incredible! I have been using a chord Mojo DAC with my Shure SE425 IEM and I thought they sounded amazing. Having run the 1540's in for a few hours now I just seem to not want to put them down. And the Mojo just brings them alive. Extremely comfy don't feel heavy either. Sound from all levels is fantastic but the details and it really is the little details that you find listening that's incredible. Again Quality of Shure is all there to see and hear!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: One of the best closed back headphone under 1000 GBP
customer_reviews.text: Very analytical and detailed headphones. High quality and balance. Recommended for studio production/composers/musicians/mastering engineers/audiophiles. A good headphone amp (DAC) is strongly recommended. These cans are not the best option if you are planning to play them through your smartphone with mp3s: you won't get the magic! If you have high quality files and a good amp these are probably one of the best choice under 1000 GBP. Please note they are analytical and balanced. If you are looking for strong basses and emphasis on the high spectrum is better if you look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to get the most out of my AK300.Definite upgrade from the Beyerdynamic T51p. Well worth the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones but check cable length is right for you
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking and comfortable to wear. Sounds great. Make sure the length of the cable is right for you as you can’t purchase different lengths from Shure. Third party companies do sell longer lengths but they aren’t cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor cable connections
customer_reviews.text: Good qality sound not for long. After 9 moths of use, one earcab stopped working, it was broke connection between cable and earcab.
customer_reviews.author: rom

customer_reviews.title: But it for shure
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones amazing sound especially when used with good source. Very comfy and just quality all round. Even the case is quality.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: The Sound quality is superb
customer_reviews.text: If you have big ears the cups can touch them Other than that they are comfortable to wear for hours. The best for me is that my ears don`t get sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of headphones, Nice clear bass on these. Can be played with full volume and still sound clear. Thanks amazon
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant set of headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so i would describe these as a listening headphones they have a slightly increased bass but still retain clarity and a sense of order. Every instrument is spaced and separate. They have a wide soundstage for a pair of closed headphones and the earcups are really compfy. Definitely good value concidering you get a cable and a set of ear cups spare. They dont have the extension of bass as the se846 but i would say they sound similar without a doubt. If anything these sound smoother and more rounded, more natural. All in all these are a good value set of cans that have the high quality and id expext to last as with most of shures gear.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great pair!
customer_reviews.text: Very good pair of headphones. You hear details you don't from others. Also very comfy. Pricey through!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ross

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Simply stunning quality. Extremely comfortable to wear, and the depth and quality of the sound reproduction is just first class. I can't see myself ever needing another pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wood

customer_reviews.title: using it with an asus essence stx II and im very satisfied, excellent for music
customer_reviews.text: Premium stuff ,using it with an asus essence stx II and im very satisfied , excellent for music ,games and movies too
customer_reviews.author: janos

customer_reviews.title: Too pricey but good quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice feel, a lot of leakage, haven't noticed a huge difference in sound quality to my Sennheisers, wouldn't say the price tag is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Aiden Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Excellent base but not overpowering
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of weeks these have come alive. Excellent base but not overpowering. Best headphones I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are amazing. But I can't recommend them to the average ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing. But I can't recommend them to the average consumer. My issue with them is their quality. It sounds convoluted but let me try to explain myself.... With these headphones you will hear every single detail of the music. Including every imperfection. Sibilance is a particular issue that I tuned into. I ended up adjusting my eq to actually try and mask the some of the detail. If you career involves extended periods of time listening to or mixing music, these are perfect for you. They are exceptionally comfortable and high quality. If you want to listen to music for your own enjoyment, buy something else (cheaper). I find myself turning to me £15 in-ears over these.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones - better for classical
customer_reviews.text: These are very dynamic, with a crazy tight and very clean smooth sound; more present, open and crisp than the Sony Z7. The bass although extremely clean, is less present until it's necessary, but can distort if pushed. Guitar, piano, vocals shine although sometimes a tiny bit thin. There are not many sets that everything sounds good, but these do. Excellent headphones, but not as present and bass is reserved. Great headset for orchestra, jazz, vocals, but not as dynamic for rock, country as I like. Checkout the picture for a premium headphone comparison
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Underrated. Great closed-back headphone.
customer_reviews.text: These are so underrated. The bass is controlled, which is desired for closed-back. The finish and appearance is great. It's light weight, but my only gripe is that the weak clamping force, and lack of swivel really seem to limit its feeling of security on your head. But damn is it one of the best closed-back headphones I've tried after correction. They fit a bit like the Bose AE2, if you've ever tried those. AE2 is a bit more comfortable though.
customer_reviews.author: TYU

customer_reviews.title: It's Shure...It's Pro Audio
customer_reviews.text: It's Shure...Pro Audio...It's good stuff. InnerFidelity gives 1540's a great review. I have open back Koss ESP 950's and the Shure 1540's are damm close. Not quite neutral...A little bass heavy, yet close in all aspects to the Koss electrostatics. Big difference being the 1540's are dynamic and are closed back for when you need those features.
customer_reviews.author: Napervillian

customer_reviews.title: Microphonics and cable defect
customer_reviews.text: Defect on one of two cables: L wire causing unstable connection, thankfully there are two cables and the second one is okay it seems. I demand a cable replacement with shipping at the seller's expense. Bought it mostly for silent electric guitar practicing. It's just not acceptable to get such a strong microphonics and defect on cables from a headphones with $500 tag. For those who are curious what that effect is: finger click a cable and you will hear it via headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Bought them 5 years ago, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: At this point I'm used to them so I don't feel "wow" every time I put them on, but even so, sometimes if I just relax and pay attention to the melodies and notes, I still feel the amazement from the early days. I've used them almost every day for 5.5 years so that's a testament to how good these are.
customer_reviews.author: nomad

customer_reviews.title: awesome headphones, superb bass and highs.
customer_reviews.text: I am a man, don't confuse the name on account it's my wife. I was looking for a good closed end headphones for some time. I needed them for gym. My second pair of MH40 from Master and Dynamic broke down. I was lucky to find SRH1540. Very happy with them amazing sound, they are way better than MH40's. These headphones make me want to stay in the gym longer, I just can't put them down. Thank you Shure!
customer_reviews.author: Genya

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of headphones. Not hard to drive. Amazing sound at lower volumes. Great soundstage and imaging. Decent isolation. The earpads are very comfortable, and the headphones themselves are very light, making them very comfortable overall. Not a huge fan of the carbon fiber look.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Share Shr1540 CLOSED headphones are super
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound they produce. I am addicted to the best (I'm gonna get a little snobbish here, in honor of a dear friend whose no longer with us) head speakers I can afford. And believe me when I say I have them .The Shure do require some break-in time. Most good headphones do. They seem to need more volume on my portable amp than my Shure 535 ear buds. Outside of that, I really do love them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gillispie

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely incredible.
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews for anything, despite spending thousands of dollars here. These headphones are magnificent. I have never heard a better quality headphone before. The only criticism I have is they are a little bass heavy, but that's fixed with an equalizer. Every sound is absolutely perfect, like I am hearing it in real life.
customer_reviews.author: susanselton

customer_reviews.title: They sound fantastic though.
customer_reviews.text: 3 days in, and the connection cables to each ear are already intermittent. Going to swap to the spare cable that's provided, and see if they stay working any longer... They sound fantastic though..
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great heaphones, sad the head cushions get damaged after 2 years of use. I think all phones have the same problems....
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo U.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is amazing! I didn’t know what to expect when I bought them
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: good build quality
customer_reviews.text: Comfort, light, good build quality. Excellent noise isolation. Sound quality is OK for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3 months - then broke
customer_reviews.text: Rattling in the left ear makes these unusable, and I've only had it for 3 months! Hopefully the repair process isn't too time consuming and/or expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn McTiernan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphone. Expensive but worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphone. Expensive but worth every penny. Extremely comfortable and durable. Build quality is great also. I love the aircraft grade aluminum with carbon fiber combo with the Alcantara ear pads. The accessories are a plus. You get 2nd pair of ears pads, a 2nd pair of headphone cables plus a hard shell carrying case. Basically this is a professional set of headphones that excels in a lot of areas such as sound stage almost like an open back headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Beckford

customer_reviews.title: Frequency response and accuracy, what more do you need?
customer_reviews.text: Best sq for closed cans in this price range bar none.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding headphone under $500
customer_reviews.text: Best sounding headphone under $500. Very comfortable as well. I also have K712 and HD650, but I prefer SRH1540 over those headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: These phones are dynamite. I've played music through them for over a week straight. The longer they burn in the better they sound.they are very clean and detailed. The sound stage is very nice. Very comfortable to wear. The case is super nice. It fit in my back pack so I took them with me to mcdonalds. At home I use a schiit magni 2 uber .at mcdonalds I used a fiio Mont blanc. Sounds great with both. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: james sawyer

customer_reviews.title: excellent balance and clarity
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Big sound stage, excellent balance and clarity. Sublime listening experience. Ear cups are very comfy and noticeably more breathable material than leather. The build seems durable too, thicker cable than some, doesn't feel like I have to be overly careful with them.
customer_reviews.author: DCT

customer_reviews.title: Holy Crap! These are hands down the best headphones I've ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy Crap! These are hands down the best headphones I've ever used. Extremely comfortable The sound quality is amazing - works especially well with 24bit files and my DAC
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: a wonderful headphone with a "live music sound" that is thrilling
customer_reviews.text: a wonderful headphone with a "live music sound" that is thrilling. not particularly accurate with a bass boost , tuned for musicality and enjoyment rather than reference. well made, light and airy. one of my favorites now...
customer_reviews.author: dr norman katz

customer_reviews.title: Expert Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Incredible set of headphones. Beautiful sound, lightweight and comfortable, and an extra cable and pair of ear cups included. I will note that the cable has a lot of "memory" to it and will retain many of the bends or waves from it being coiled up inside of the packaging, but there are ways to remedy this problem. You could also choose to buy an entirely different and higher quality cable. But overall, very nice pair of headphones. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mayor

customer_reviews.title: Superbly bananced headphones for hi-res digital music
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully balanced sound, deep sound stage from good lossless/hi-res sources with strong DACs such as the iBasso DX90 and especially the Schiit Bifrost DAC + Asgard 2 headphone preamp I'm currently using for home listening. They are big but pretty light, allowing extended listening without tired neck muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Pereira

customer_reviews.title: A super comfy audiophile-grade headphone with no gimmicks
customer_reviews.text: I own BeoPlay H8s, Senns Momentum 2.0, Fostex TH900, Shure SE846, Bose QC25, and Senns IE800. These don't have bluetooth, noise canceling, or an inline mic and remote, but I find myself listening to them a lot because they are super comfortable and provide a warmish, balanced, detailed sound. Good passive isolation.
customer_reviews.author: E. Witkowski

customer_reviews.title: For once What Hi-Fi were true to their review. ...
customer_reviews.text: For once What Hi-Fi were true to their review. The sound out of these is sublime. It's rare that one gets emotional over electronic gear, but the sound from these was simply gorgeous. They're my reference now for what something 'should sound like'....
customer_reviews.author: cpeely

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones
customer_reviews.text: Balanced sound, not too boomy, and clear highs. Very comfortable for long sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think with a little stretching it will be perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is that the headband is a bit tight with pressure on top of head. I think with a little stretching it will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great job this time.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional nor equipped with the observational skills of a true audiophile. But on the most fundamental level for my purposes, these are the best headphones I've ever used coming from SRH840s. These finally have the bass response I've always wanted out of the 840s. They're also way, way more comfortable and feel lighter. One caveat is that they sound way better from a powered source. So if you plan to exclusively use an iPhone or iPad as your source...you will likely be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Outstanding!!!
customer_reviews.text: Shure... well known around the world as probably the absolute leader in professional quality and sound has made in my opinion the best set of headphones to crown my dome. These are those cans.
customer_reviews.author: Narbytrout

customer_reviews.title: One of the more comfortable headphones I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: One of the more comfortable headphones I've ever used. For a closed-back, the quality of the audio is also very good. I purchased several different models (P7, Beyerdynamic T1) and these were the best for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: These are very good sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are very good sounding headphones. I give it 4 stars for quality, but I feel it's very overpriced, so it doesn't get the full 5.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear but sound is a bit disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The packaging is disappointing and the sound quality isn't up to the (high res audio) headphones standards but it's so comfortable to wear for long hours of gaming or working, maybe after 5hrs or so it'll start to feel warm on you ears, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Khalid Owaida Alhajri

customer_reviews.title: Great sound! Sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.text: Sound reproduction is so dynamic and true. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Reno

customer_reviews.title: If you appreciate fine headphones that are accurate
customer_reviews.text: Incredible Studio reference headphones. These are natural, open, spacious cans that are accurate and detailed. If you are a heavy bass fan these are not for you. If you appreciate fine headphones that are accurate, pacy and neutral with concert quality tones and an expansive soundstage then these are for you. When you break them in the bass is tight and present. They are audiophile headphones of the highest quality!
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: volume was not good and noticed some buzzing
customer_reviews.text: Initially bought the Audio-Technica ATH-M50X, and after about a week and a half of use, noticed something wrong the the right earphone, volume was not good and noticed some buzzing. Enter Shure's SRH 1540. Night and day difference. It looks huge, but surprisingly very light, did not feel any clamping or pressure when I have them on and the passive noise canceling is quite good. The extra cables and ear cups are awesome. For the money, this is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: KDM

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, a bit too tight
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality, four star because of small issue with comfort, it feels a bit too tight, especially when wearing it long, feels like a bit too much pressure on my ears and it is not adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bilinskyy

customer_reviews.title: best headphone i've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: best headphone i've ever owned. think beats but with full range and the build quality similar to Bose. And they weigh close to nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: but overall boring signature. Like incredibly boring
customer_reviews.text: impressive soundstage, but overall boring signature. Like incredibly boring sounding
customer_reviews.author: Daniel ruelle

customer_reviews.title: $500 Build quality? YES. $500 Sound quality? NO
customer_reviews.text: Well not unless your ideal sound signature is spacious, bassy and nearly Beats-like in the veiling of high frequencies. Maybe I had a bum sample, but having read and heard about the clarity of high frequencies on this headphone, I was shocked to find them so oppressively warm. Great mids down through the bottom end (male vocals sound great), but upper-mids through the highest frequencies are MIA! They make the relatively flat VISO HP50 sound absolutely bright! Not my idea of $500 sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Garland Cary

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased these headphones and they are the best sounding heaphones ive ever heard i bought these as ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these headphones and they are the best sounding heaphones ive ever heard i bought these as i do soundboard for plays and musicals however ive found i use them all the time to listen to music. I have a fiio e17k alpen 2 amp and dac using the dac part definetely makes a difference with the s6 active i recomend it a lot. These headphones are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Best Listening Headphones For Me
customer_reviews.text: These are the best music "listening" headphones I have owned, so very happy. I say "listening" as am more used to DJ and monitoring headphones. With these headphones I get all the detail when listening to music, plus a completely enjoyable hi-fi experience. Thanks Shure - I will now listen to my whole music collection again. Any negatives......I don't like the cable or connectors. Otherwise great! PS - don't try using these for phones or tablets - the sound will be awful without a DAC.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bravin

customer_reviews.title: A ‘SOUND’ PURCHASE !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is excellent, could leave them on for hours.... very comfortable. Overall sound quality ..... excellent !
customer_reviews.author: Phil B.

customer_reviews.title: Truly superb headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have owned these headphones for about 4 years, and feel so delighted with the purchase. I have never once been disappointed or wanted for more. If I've been listening on lesser headphones (eg. noise cancelling ones) or speakers, when I come back to them the experience is just so incredible. They're light, comfortable and have the most exceptional ability to bring music to life. They sound so open and dynamic. You feel involved in the music in a way basic headphones can't. If you love music, these are a gift to yourself that you absolutely can afford. Spectacularly good!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wells

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Tested these against Oppo PM-3, AKG K701, Meze 99 Classic, AKG K553, AT-MDR7 etc. I could not believe how much better these were in all areas. These gave me goosebumps regardless of music style. Human voice sounded so natural, bass was there and very detailed and highs were natural (not like the Beyer Dynamic with a spike). I used Aune X7S with DagMagic 100 (set to higher rate) and SMSL Sanskrit Panda stack. All with enhanced power supplies. Same result with both setups. So I used to have a headphone collection, now I only have these. Focal Utopia might be even better but the price is 7-8x of these.
customer_reviews.author: Photomic2000

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely sensational headphones. Expensive but well worth it for anyone who is serious about music. Just the right balance of bass and treble. Vocals are crystal clear , right at the front of the mix. Instrument separation is absolutely exquisite. Everything about them is quality. I previously had a pair of senn hd650, which were great but these a definite upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Collier

customer_reviews.title: Delicious sounding phones
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from AKG551 cans and they are a substantial improvement. Supreme clarity and soundstage. A very satisfying full sound. No overblown bass nonsense - just the music as recorded. They are not tricky to power but a headphone amp always gives more punch. Very very comfortable - you can forget they are on. If you can afford the price then these are superb headphones.
customer_reviews.author: the Green Man

customer_reviews.title: Coming from engineered exciting sounding headphones like the momentum on ears
customer_reviews.text: Coming from engineered exciting sounding headphones like the momentum on ears, which forums tell me are V shaped in terms of accentuated bass and treble, you think more balanced phones aren't initially as enjoyable, but they are exceptional when your ears get attuned, the detail is on a different planet. Another positive is, and I'm an ugly person so not used to turning heads out and about, but these massive princess lea cans strapped to my head, I've been getting a lot of looks on the street.
customer_reviews.author: M W AUSTIN

customer_reviews.title: Headband
customer_reviews.text: The headband is bad It should be fully foam padded and covered with leather or it should use a strap like Dan Clark Audio Aeon headphones
customer_reviews.author: Listener

customer_reviews.title: Among the best headphones at 500£ range
customer_reviews.text: Premium sound signature and clarity, they scale well with high end amplifiers. Quite comparable to the Sennheiser HD650 without much compromise and quite portable for a full size headphone. A clear winner for acoustic and electronic music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: I heard good things about the bass of this headphones which is why I bought it. Disappointingly there is a huge sound leakage problem. Bass is also not what I expected. A bit overrated to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: C

product_meta.title: Shure SRH1540 Professional Premium Closed-back Headphones, clear, extended highs and warm, accurate bass, aluminum alloy and carbon fiber construction, Alcantara® ear pads, detachable cable, black/silver
product_meta.description: The SRH1540 Premium Closed-Back Headphones feature an expansive soundstage for clear, extended highs and warm bass. Developed with aluminium alloy and carbon fibre construction, the lightweight and durable design also features Alcantara ear pads for maximum sound isolation and comfort. An included storage case, replacement set of ear pads, and an additional dual-exit cable ensure years of uninterrupted listening enjoyment.
feature_bullets: Ideal for professional engineers, musicians, and audiophiles
Expansive soundstage with clear, extended highs and warm bass.
Developed with aluminium alloy and carbon fibre construction for super lightweight design and durability
Oxygen-free copper cable (OFC) with Kevlar reinforced jacket
Frequency Range: 5 Hz – 25 kHz. Cable Length: 6 ft (1.8 m)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars179 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
